Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery plate; inside: beige slip; raised relief band at join of rim and floor; similar bands on outside at base of rim and on underside; traces of slip on underside. Inside: frieze of crescents on rim; on relief band, sets of double verticals between bands with added red and white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to pottery analysis by P. Dupont (personal communication, 30-31 May 1978) at the Centre de recherches archéologiques, laboratoire de céramologie, the clay from this sherd originated in North Ionia. According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80), according to the geochemical characteristics of the fabric, the sherd probably originates in the region of Teos. Sample number 'NAU 51' (Dupont and Thomas 2006, 78-9).
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (78-9, fig. 4, 80) (NAU 51)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.774)
